GENERAL ACCOUNTANT
Career Focus
To obtain a position which will allow me to utilize skills I have acquired through my education and work experiences while continuing to expand my knowledge.
Energetic and motivated student dedicated to providing top-quality patient care.
I have ten years of administrative support service with five years of that being in a senior position.
I work proficiently in a team environment and demonstrate excellent interpersonal skills.
I am detailed and multi-task oriented and believe that I can efficiently accomplish any task placed before me.

Functional Experience
Completed 320 hours of clinical work Recorded patients' medical history, vital statistics and test results in medical records.
Monitored post-op vitals, fluids, reviewed post-op orders and orient patients to unit.
Assisted patients with healing and recovery after surgery.
Provided education to patients on detox and withdrawal, medications, addiction, recovery, coping skills and community resources.
Provided necessary health education training for patients.
Provided behavioral/emotional support and supervision for those with dementia, Alzheimer's, schizophrenia and suicidal ideation.
Assisted patients with multiple chronic diagnoses including COPD and asthma.Evaluated patient care needs, prioritized treatment and maintained patient flow.
Tested glucose and administered injections.
Monitored patient's respiration activity, blood pressure and blood glucose levels in response to medical administration.
Assisted patients with bathing, dressing, daily hygiene care and grooming.
Patient Advocacy Explained treatment procedures, medication risks, special diets and physician instructions to patients.

SKILLS

Healthcare:   Sound, ethical and independent decision-making ability consistent with medical protocols, Patient advocacy, Post-operative care, Medical-Surgical experience, Mental Health experience, Operating room experience, patient education, Glucose monitoring, Strong assessment skills
People skills : Great bedside manner, Enthusiastic people person, Advanced problem — solving , Great organizational skills
Clerical: Administrative support, Balance, Bookkeeping, Clerical, Closing, credit, Customer Service, Dun, Senior management, Imaging, Mainframe, Medical Billing, Medical Transcription, Minute taking, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, 2000, MS Word, Nursing, progress, RIS, SAP, Scheduling, Staffing, Supervisor, Symposium, Phones, Transcription, Type 72wpm

<JD_START>
Job Title: Staff Accountant

Location: Austin, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Finance

Description:
We are looking for an energetic Staff Accountant looking to obtain accelerated learning and

experience in a fast-paced, high growth environment. Our health insurance organization is seeking an entry level Staff Accountant. The successful applicant will work on accounts payable, accounts receivable and other general accounting and reconciliation tasks. A number of tasks requiring data analysis, in-depth evaluation, and exercising judgment within

the appropriate scope of practice. We offer excellent benefits, generous paid time off and a competitive salary. You must be a highly organized professional with a great eye for detail. You must be reliable, able to carry out tasks autonomously and be able to work collaboratively as needed. The goal is to keep the accounts payable and financial processes of the company up to standard and ensure accurate financial reporting and control.

This is a full-time on-site role. You will report to the Accounting Manager.

Job Responsibilities

Handle accounts payable for multiple related entities and vendors, properly coding for accurate financial statements. All facets of vendor relations from facilitating setup, entering invoices, managing vendor inquiries and communication. Ensuring proper internal control and support, including supporting other company departments as it relates to payables. Reconciling processed work by verifying entries and comparing system reports to balancesRecording of month end accruals, and other accounts payable related journal entries. Maintaining historical recordsPreparing analyses of accounts and producing monthly reportsContinuing to improve the accuracy and payment process. Support improvements to financial processes and procedures. Assisting with audits as neededHandle workload in a timely and accurate mannerSpecial projects as required. Additional responsibilities as required. 

Qualifications/Skills

Bachelor’s degree in finance, accounting, economics, business administration or related field required (3.0 GPA or greater)Prior experience with NetSuite ERP System is a plus. Attention to detail. Ability to and willingness to learn. Efficient communication and ability to work in a team environment. Proficient in MS ExcelAuthorized to work in the US

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
<JD_END>
